H0.text: Which Aztec ruler was deposed by Cortez. Moctezuma II's brother, Cuitláhuac

H1.text: Which Aztec ruler was deposed by Cortez. Tizoc

H2.text: Which Aztec ruler was deposed by Cortez. Axayacatl

H3.text: Which Aztec ruler was deposed by Cortez. Montesuma

A4.text: Moctezuma was killed during the initial stages of the Spanish conquest of the Aztec Empire when Hernán Cortés, the Spanish conquistador, and his men seized the Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan.

A5.text: Moctezuma was then succeeded by his brother Cuitláhuac, who died shortly afterwards during a smallpox epidemic.

A6.text: Cortés captured Cuauhtémoc, the tlatoani of Tenochtitlán, on 13 August 1521.

A7.text: The ruling council of Tenochtitlan had voted to depose Motecuzoma and had elected his brother Cuitlahuac as the new emperor.

A8.text: Cortés claims that he used this incident as an excuse to take Motecuzoma prisoner under threat of force.

A9.text: Cortés imprisoned both Moctezuma and Cuitláhuac.

A10.text: Cuitláhuac was released on the pretense to reopen the market to get food to the invaders.
